item.title: Country Holidays is introducing new Signature Departures for the year 2015
item.description: Luxury travel agency Country Holidays has launched new “Signature Departures” trips for discerning travelers based in Singapore. Established in 2011, Signature Departures offers a fresh approach to group travel, steering clear of crowded buses, generic hotels, large-scale dining, and tourist traps. Theng Hwee Chang, Managing Director of Country Holidays, explains: “We created Signature Departures four years ago to address the increasing demand for more enriching group travel experiences that go beyond the ordinary.

item.title: Is the Court of Justice in Bank Refah Kargaran making a groundbreaking decision by allowing action for damages in relation to CFSP decisions regarding restrictive measures?
item.description: Professor Dr. Peter Van Elsuwege and Joyce De Coninck (PhD Researcher), Ghent European Law Institute The recent Grand Chamber judgment in the case of Bank Refah Kargaran v Council, issued on October 6, 2020, sheds further light on the Court of Justice of the European Union’s (CJEU) jurisdiction concerning the EU’s Common Foreign and Security Policy (CFSP). Drawing on previous judgments such as Elitaliana, H v. Council, Rosneft, and SatCen vs.
